q: Investigator: Wait To See If Michael Vick Has Changed ESPN.com- The man who led the U.S. government's investigation of Michael Vick 's dogfighting case said that he's withholding judgment on the quarterback's rehabilitation. Do I think he's changed? I don't know, said retired U.S. Department of Agriculture senior special agent Jim Knorr, speaking to ESPN's Outside The Lines.`` I would hope he has but I don't know. Only one person knows and that's him

Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. And so was born` the special comment''-- his first one coming in August 2006, rebutting a speech that then-Defense Donald Rumsfeld had delivered to the American Legion. Said Keith Olbermann that night: The confusion we-- as its citizens-- must now address, is stark and forbidding. But variations of it have faced our forefathers, when men like Nixon and McCarthy and Curtis LeMay have darkened our skies and obscured our flag.
